comment: Terrible teacher. Said 90% of learning is outside class so, why pay tuition? He wasn't helpful when asked questions and often left me more confused. I only passed by teaching myself from the textbook. He does offer extra credit and review sessions, which helps a bit. He is funny so his class isn't a total bore but I wouldn't recommend him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Haseltine is an awesome organic chemistry professor. I took him for both 3361 and 3362 and i excelled in both classes. I do understand the negative feedbacks but you have look beyond that, persevere and work hard to earn a good grade. You start to enjoy his class if you learn to adapt to his teaching style. I do recommend Dr. Haseltine.

I don't understand all the negative reviews. Haseltine is not a bad prof, but know grade is based off of 3 exams (1 gets dropped) and the final. No graded HW or quizzes. Read the textbook and work all the problems like he says and you will be ok. Gives a huge curve, so an A or B is attainable if you put in some effort. Nice guy, very knowledgeable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is very smart and funny, however he is not good at teaching. He lectures like the students are on the same level as him and does a poor job of explaining concepts. He also goes too fast to really understand what he is talking about. The average for one of his tests was a 36%, meaning even with his curve it was a D.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: he does a heavy heavy curve because he does not teach the class well. he is very confusing and gives really roundabout answers to any questions you ask.

No homework, but he teaches really bad. He is really smart but is not a very good teacher. I had to get notes and other help from people who had taken other professors. If you can avoid this professor, if you have to take him, buy a copy of the textbook and make it your bestfriend. The textbook and youtube is the only reason I got an A.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures are not PowerPoints, they are notes he personally writes. Homework isn't given for a grade, only for practice. He's a nice guy, but he goes off topic a lot. He holds review sessions outside fo class which are him just going over practice tests and doesn't explain much here. Tests are difficult, but the curve he gives is huge.

I had him for the lab. Don't take him. Very very very tough grader and doesn't tell us what he wants in the first place. He wanted his students to learn what he wants from us by looking at the way he graded it? so basically get an F and learn what he wanted AFTER the lab has already been graded. plus doesn't give good feedbacks.

Dr. Haseltine is difficult to comprehend at first. His tests are extremely difficult but he does curve a whole letter grade or more for each exam. No homework, quizzes or other grades. Only 3 exams and the final - one exam may be dropped. Be prepared to learn the material on your own. Mechanism problems are graded very harshly. Study hard!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Organic Chemistry is already hard enough as it is and I feel like he doesn't make it easier on you. He isn't really organized. Every week quizzes would be over new material while lectures were still over the old material we didn't finish yet. I did like how he rounded tests up a whole letter grade. I'd make a C and somehow it turned into a B
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Haseltine is a nice person, but he veers off the material and goes into more obscure stuff a lot. You don't really know what the tests will be over. He will provide tests from previous years/semesters, but they're not easy to practice off of. A lot of his lectures are not from the book. His lectures are VERY fast-paced its hard to keep up
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Most lectures were just him blabbing on about pointless topics that didn't pertain to the course or help us learn more about Ochem. For quizzes, he locks the door the minute class starts and will not let you in to take the quiz. Unable to be in class for a really good reason? Don't even try asking to make it up. He's unhelpful and confusing.

Be prepared to take a quiz on the second lecture of the semester. Make sure you are prepared to take true/false quizzes every other lecture. You mostly have to self teach the material because his lectures are organized in a weird way. He teaches like you know the subject. Be prepared to put the effort in to pass this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Haseltine was absolutely amazing. He made a notoriously hard class seem like a breeze. He has a great way of explaining the concepts, and he gives very generous curves. He really knows his stuff about o chem, and he really wants everyone to succeed in his class. I wish I could take him for orgo 2. TAKE HIM, he's awesome!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: Very difficult class but he understands that and doesn't expect everyone to be experts. Generous grading and curving. I would definitely read the material he talks about in class AHEAD of time. Class is really just him reviewing the material, not teaching it. Fairly helpful guy, funny and obviously understands ochem extremely well.

Haseltine is a fantastic professors and expects the very best out of his students. His quizzes come straight from the textbook, word from word. Organic chemistry is a hard subject, but his test are very clear and straight to the point compared to other professors who over complicate it. He curves grades based on class performance.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: He is such a great guy! He is willing to go out of his way to help when you need him too. He puts up old tests and worksheet for practice. I took him over the summer, yes it was very hard, and I had many many late nights studying. He curves the tests and it was my first time taking o chem. I would take his class again. Very sweet man!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: There are teachers that make you regurgitate what you learn and there are others like Haseltine that make you apply it. Definitely one of the toughest classes I have taken. Be ready to put in a ton of work for this class. weekly quizzes (T or F) come from the book, tests come from lecture. got a 94 in his class (80 was an A, 65 B, 55 C)
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This is my second time taking this class and it is incredibly hard. Professor does not go by the book, you have to draw reactions for his exams (many ochem professors do NOT require that), and he quizzes every class. He hardly gives extra credit but does give generous curves. You'll teach yourself everything, lectures are not helpful. BookBFF

I took Haseltine for my third attempt at o chem and I might have a shot at a B this semester with the curved exams. Read the book! For spring semester, it was a quiz every Thursday. If you took decent notes on the chapter ahead of class, the lecture was a breeze. First time I've actually understood what was going on! He posts old exams to practice!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: definitely not for the weak of mind or spirit. You will need to put in a lot of studying outside class, and even then don't just expect an A. He knows his subject and if you're willing to put in the groundwork you will walk away with a true understanding of the material. He also has a pretty straightforward grading policy.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: I took him over the summer and I went to every class and was constantly studying. No matter how hard I studied I would get a C or lower on the test. This was the only class I was taking so all my time was devoted to this class. I took lab on top of this and got an A. He wrote his notes on the white board and taught as if you already knew it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Don't taking him unless you want you G.P.A to drop. You will study and go to class but it still won't be enough. he doesn't give powerpoint but exams come from what he teaches in class. He believes the textbook is wrong so he doesn't test so much from it. his exams are tricky too. Run don't walk-take another professor.

Requires reading chapter before he lectures and tests on material. Quizzes  test grade. Tests over 2-3 chapters of material with a 20 question test, 50% are non-multiple choice questions. Makes class extremely difficult for the level he is teaching. He has a complex that requires him to prove his intelligence by sticking to you. Take someone else!

Dr. H is such a great professor & really loves Organic chemistry.  He really strives for all of his students to have the same passion for the subject.  His tests are very tough, but he is the best professor I've had.  If you commit the time to the class, you will do well. Didn't do as well as I would've liked, but would I'd definitely take again.
had summer semester, was a tough class but i still made a B. very time consuming. Pop quizzes every classs. Tests were hard

Dr. Haseltine makes organic chemistry come to life. He is clearly passionate about what he does, and yes it's a difficult class, but o chem is hard by nature. He is an interesting fellow and his lectures are beautiful.

My advice? Drink a lot of caffeine and stay sharp in his class. He moves fast, but is a very clear and thorough lecturer and loves to answer questions. Do everything to review for the exam that he puts on the review checklist. Go to SI. His tests are very difficult but he does curve. I got a 48 on one test and that was still a C with the curve.

He's a very smart chemist (I know bc he brags about it so much), but not great at lecture. Didnt learn from him. Does give lots of resources though. Gives quizzes that equal a test grade, 3 tests and final. He curves which helps A LOT. Try to get at least B avg. on quizzes (by reading everyword in book),SI helps, and practice all the stuff on d2l.

His class was extremely difficult. I would study day and night for his exams and he would look for the smallest incorrect answers I had and act as if I had missed an entire question. I would also go to his office hours for more clarity but that didn't get me anywhere. He always had this sarcastic, higher-than-thou feel and always seemed obnoxious.

Take this class over the summer!! It does ruin your summer, but if you focus you will come out with a better grade than if you take it in the Fall or Spring. He curves all of the tests and lowest test and quiz grades are dropped. Don't get behind! He assigns readings for every class and a quiz over the reading.

This class is not for the weak. If you are a nursing major and want to get into the program, get ready to work! This is the weed-out class. Laziness is not an option. If you don't want to read before the quizzes or show up to class, CHANGE YOUR MAJOR! He curves each test and is clear about what will be on the exams. It's your own fault if you fail.

Took this class over the summer. It was doable but I couldn't imagine taking it with another class. He gives old exams and practice pages that are just like the exams, and he curves anywhere from 5 to 15 points for each exam. He drops the lowest test and quiz. It is doable but you get what you give.I would not recommend freshman taking this class.

Really great professor but tests are extremely hard. I took his class over the summer and we had a quiz every day we did not have a test. This class takes work but, he is a very nice guy and will help you best he can. 3 test: drops lowest. 11 quizzes drops lowest. 1 final: mandatory and no midterm.

The general consensus about Professor Haseltine is, for the most part true, his test are hard as hell, and you can forget about getting extra credit. That being said, in my opinion, one of the best teachers I have ever had. If you want an easy grade then don't take him, if you want to learn it, then take him.

I have taken organic 1 and 2 twice. So when I say this professor was the most clear and helpfull, I mean out of all the other organic professors. Tests are hard, but he's the only prof that curves, which will ultimately lead to a C or better if you at least try. He's funny during lecture (look out for him to check his imaginary watch on his wrist)
This class is super hard. Dr. Haseltine is difficult but not the worst OChem prof at KSU . He does explain the reaction and is kind of humorous. I hate this class though.
Dr. Haseltine is an amazing professor. He really knows his chemistry and is friendly and approachable. The tests are extremely difficult but it's organic 2 so that is to be expected.

He is the BEST. Yes, he is tough. Yes, the material is rough. But if you actually want to learn and do something hes the one to take. I would recommend making a few friends in the class to study together. It is a lifesaver. Trust me. You will have to put a lot of time into it but it is worth it especially if chemistry is what you want in life.

He is a GREAT professor. He knows his chemistry and is a really smart guy. My personal favorite chemistry teacher at KSU. He is always willing to stay after class and help you. That being said you do have to prepare for his weekly quiz by reading the chapter ahead. His tests are hard but do able. If you study you can do well and learn alot!

He is known as the hardest O-chem professor at Kennesaw. The man is absolutely brilliant and a wonderful teacher, but VERY difficult. 3 Tests (lowest dropped) plus the final. Do not take him if you are looking to just learn the bare-minimum. In his class you will either learn the chemistry thoroughly or you will not do well.

To clarify what everyone on here is tripping about, yes, you have to read the text before class, take a quiz, then learn. BUT the quizzes are truefalse. His tests are challenging though. But if you actually care about getting the education you're paying for then take Dr. H cause the only way you'll pass is by developing  major study skills.

Took this class over the summer. Best decision ever made. Gave you 4 practice exams (to take on your own)before every exam. Quizzes everyday, keeps you focused on the material. lots of reading. definitely a difficult class. But not impossible. Made an A.

Do not take him if you have the option.  He received 5 complaints to the department from my class alone. He makes you read the textbook and quizzes from it then tells you not to listen to the author. He answers your questions with another question. I had a better luck teaching myself the material than relying on him.

Dr.Haseltine is hard and makes you work extremely hard for your grade. He curves tests, and the quizzes are what saved me.He went by a point system which is better because if it wasn't I would have failed. But instead I got a B. If you're doing horrible on the tests, just make sure do extremely well on quizzes for cushion. READ THOROUGHLY.

okay so dr. haseltine is diffucult. the material is alot and difficult and on top of that he teaches this course like we are a chemistry major class and 95% of us were nursing majors. We took a quiz every day and had to read every chapter. His tests are hard, a lot of hard short answer. If you want an A, you should pick another teacher.

Haseltine might be the worst teacher I've ever had. Extremely hard material and he expects you to know the stuff before he even lectures. Quizzes every class, 3 tests (lowest drops). Tests are curved, but doesn't help much. Don't take him unless you have to. Over half my class dropped by the end.

Organic chemistry is an extremely hard subject, so any organic class will be difficult. However, Dr. Haseltine makes this class even harder! He makes you 25 pages of chemistry, quizzes you on it, and THEN teaches that material. His tests are very different from the practice tests. His tests are unbelievably hard. I would not recommend taking him.

He gives you a roadmap for success and lets you know what to do to make an A, the problem is this would take about 20 hours of studying a week. So not much hope if you are taking alot of classes or have a job. by far the toughest professor ive ever had

Nightmare. I had a 4.0 before this class, and made a big, fat F. He has you READ CHEMISTRY, quizzes you over it, THEN attempts to explain it after you fail the quiz. I don't care if this is the only class you need to graduate. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE before you take him. He could not care LESS if you pass.
Knows his Chemistry, but acts overly smart, marks you down for everything and anything. Take him at your own risk. I won't be taking him for organic chem.
It's not an easy class, but Dr. Hasletine really wants students to learn. He loves what he teaches and tries hard to make it enjoyable.

great teacher and person but very hard but chemistry is a hard suibject. you really have to work alone and alot to do good in this class. he was review the information but you have to learn it on your own .

AVOID HASELTINE if you are not good with chemistry. He often times talked way over students heads. He gave many resources to use to study, but nothing compared to what he tested on. Haseltine is actually a nice guy, however he is just too smart to be teaching. Do not take him if you are not good at chemistry. I'm warning you..

Thw worst teacher ever, extremely DIFFICULT at grading, will mark you down for trivial things, i would not recommend, he knows he stuff, but its impossible to make an A in this class. if you take this class its at your own risk.wish i had not taken him, biggest mistake.
haseltine knows the material but does not know how to teach. He hates Stocker(the writer of 1152 textbook), thinks he's very funny but he's not. There is no way I take any class with this guy again.

he is really hard but possible. i studied about 30 hours on average for each test and still did not do that great. i ended up with a B in the class but worked like crazy for it. try to avoid if you can

Haseltine moves fast and doesn't stop. You HAVE to seek him out to get your questions answered, and he's INCREDIBLY helpful and a GENIUS. Do NOT miss class if you can help it, your notes are VERY important. His 3361 class picks up RIGHT where 3360 left off. READ THE BOOK, the quizzes EVERY WEEK really help your grade!

Absolutely a great professor!!! He gives practices pages, exams, and quizzes all written by him. They help you to learn his style. No BS from him. He gives you the tools to succeed all you have to do is follow them. Very helpful and always checks to make sure you're getting the information.

he has his own methods of teaching but the way he explains things is very satisfactory. He may seem hard but if you read the book thoroughly you are good to go. if he makes the test hard he knows that too and in the end he does gives the curves based on the difficulty of the test. if get a chance should take him as he is good and knows what he does
EXTREMELY HARD.

This is a very hard class but this professor makes it great. He is obviously very intelligent and knows what he is teaching very well. He gives you many practice pages, practice quizzes and practice test to help you study. Read the textbook, attend class, and study and you can get an A. Your effort will reflect your grade.

Not an easy professor but the class isnt easy period. Provides lots of practice problems for quizes/tests but you will have to do these to have a chance at making a good grade. He curves tests and quizes are T/F questions from material you read the night before & what he has yet to teach on. Dont know that I would take him again if I had the chance

Do not take all of these post as being accurate. Yes his class is not easy but if you do your work and ask questions then you will be fine. He tells you how to pass the class. I got an A and I know several others in the class did as well. You have to put the time in but he knows his stuff and so will you if you pay attention! I liked him

took him for 3361. I ended up getting a C in the class. HOWEVER, that is my fault. this course is hard. the professor is fair. he teaches BUT you MUST (MUST) do extra practice in order to comprehend material. you must not have a "feeling" of understanding but must understand the whole concept in order to do good. fair professor though.

DO NOT TAKE HIM!!! He is ridiculous...if you take him and end up with a bad grade in the class do not be upset because you knew better from all of these post!!!! After the 2nd test last semester the class average was a 45..yup thats right a 45......

He is flat out ridiculous. I worked so hard in his class. Did all the homeworks, made 80s on quizzes and failed the tests so I ended up with a D in the class. His test are nothing like the practice problems given and his examples during lecture. I should have withdrew from the class when I had the chance. Would not reccommed to anyone.

Absolutely ridiculous! He is so incredibly hard and probably competes with Einstein's level of brillance. You have to give it hours and hours of your time, so basically- he sucks! Don't even consider it!

Horrible teacher. I busted my butt in this class. Studied and still passed. The material taught in class was not what was on the tests. Didn't follow to the books information. His teaching style is horrible, almost robotic. The practices that he put up were overwhelming not helpful at all. Wish I had looked on here 1st. Would never have taken him!

Very difficult teacher, but an "A" is possible if you work for it. You MUST attend all lectures & do all practice probs. Some students think they can show up for the quiz and then leave before lecture starts- then they complain when they fail his exams. I got an A after getting a 67 on the final. He's tough but he gives you the tools to succeed

Dr. Haseltine loves chemistry and has an interesting sense of humor. However, I personally did not learn well from him. It seems that he is more concerned with getting through the material than the students' comprehension. I earned a high B in his class, but I had to teach myself and rely on his horrendously high curves. Save your time and money.

Great teacher. Not for lazy or dumb students. His online practice materials help a lot. His tests are not regurgitation but actually test whether you understand and can *apply* concepts. I think he explains everything clearly but you have to pay very close attention and not be texting during class!

Worst teacher ever.Nothing he teaches in class compares to the exam.The hardest concepts were discussed for the shortest time and most tested upon.I read all the AWFUL ratings but I HAD to take the class.Now I wish I had waited. I studied 20+hrs/wk. and felt confident about the test material. Still failed his tests. He sucks..AVOID at all costs!!

WORST teacher I've ever had in my LIFE. I had a foreigner for Chem 1 and did better in his class. Hasletine wants everyone to know that only a few will make A's...and I think he purposefully confuses students so they won't do well. He doesn't explain anything. You'd be better off never coming in contact with him, you teach yourself. RUINED my gpa.

This class is very difficult. Slacking isn't an option if you want to pass. He is a very good professor and will meet with you to help. I suggest doing that! Read the chapters he gives quizzes and STUDY! I got a B and worked for it! Everything builds off the chap before so make sure you know it!!
DO NOT TAKE HIM. HE SERIOUSLY MAKES THIS CLASS SOO HARD. NOTHING HE TEACHES IS ON THE TESTS, HE PUTS TRICK QUESTIONS ON EVERY TEST. SERIOUSLY DO NOT TAKE HIM UNLESS YOU WANT TO FAIL

Worst professor I have ever had....hands down. Will continuosly remind you that he is an organic chemist, which is what he should do instead of teach. He had to re-test on the first test because all the grades were so low. Cares more about getting through the text than teaching it. Doesn' care if you learn it or not. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!

Worst professor I ever had by far. Alwsy reminding you that he is an organic chemist and that is what he should do...not teach. He was not at all concerned that noone was getting the class...more concerned with getting through the material. He tests you every week on material that he has not even lectured on. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!

he's not bad at all but his tests are..be ready to study like a nerd. tries to be funny which helps when everything else is not making sense.overall grade for him is a B coz he tries to make students get good grades e.g by giving a retest if the students did not do 2 well.

He has practice quizzes and test for each test and quiz. Quizzes consist of reading the book from the sections he request. If you read the book you should do well on them. The test are kinda confusing. Make sure to study at least 5 hrs a week. Multiple choice questions are confusing hardest part. Drops one test and 2 quizzes. Online homework was ok

1st off this is Org 2 - not EZ unless you are a genius. He made the topic clear through examples & notes. His weekly quiz helps you stay with the reading & boost your grade. He loves the subj so I stopped hating it. Tests: do the book problems, all of them. Ask questions bring your work to him -he will xplain in english. Read the book be prepared

At first, I was entirely upset with Dr. Haseltine because he did not come from the textbook, his notes are short, and yet there is so much material to go over for the test. Studying for his tests were hard and time-consuming. However he will do what he can to give an A to the students that try hard and really care about their grade.

Great professor! He's always willing to answer questions or do another example. He even scheduled optional study sessions the week of exams to work through his study guide with us. Awesome! He gives true/false quizzes, but if you study the textbook before coming to class you'll do fine (pay attention to the green boxes and side notes).

If you take this class be prepared for an overwhelming amount of whiners in your class.  Organic Chem is not easy and Haseltine does a great job teaching it.  He is more than willing to help students succeed.  thise who complain about his teaching are using him as a scapegoat for not putting in an adequate effort.  You need to read the text!!!!

What a great professor!No, he doesn't spoonfeed you the course. It's challenging, but the reward is worth it. Dr. Haseltine is charming, funny, and cares about his students and the course. You get what you put into it.

This professor by far has the weirdest way of calculating your grade. Be prepared to retake it again and only jump up one letter grade. Don't even bother going to class because most of his notes are confusing and do not relate to the test. Basically you really need to teach yourself in this class.

I really liked Dr. Haseltine.  The class is incredibly hard but he is willing to help you if you ask for it.  Definitely read the book and go to the review sessions that he offers, it helped me a lot.  He does really love this subject, he is very enthusiastic about it, and he can be funny and entertaining as well.  I think he's a great teacher.

This class wasn't the easiest in the world, and it took a lot of effort to maintain an A, but Haseltine is a great teacher.  He is very clear in his lectures, and is extremely patient about answering questions.  He LOVES his subject and LOVES sharing his knowledge. Go to class, attend his study sessions.  He curves & drops lowest tests.

Haseltine is great! I have always disliked chemistry in general, but I found his organic class to be really fascinating. He really enjoys teaching and talking about chem, so if you need help or have a question he's delighted to discuss it. The tests are hard, but DUH - it's organic chemistry! What did you expect? (Oh and he's American! no accent)

I think there are only 2 teachers for this class. The subject is hard, but Hasletine understands that and curves the grades. Gives lots of worksheets online to practice with. Gives reviews and is very good about answering e-mail. You must read the book to answer the m/c q's. Drops 1 test and open book quizzes. He does everything he can to help.

RUN! I had to teach myself this class. The book was very helpful when teaching yourself. He has notes, but they are all problems so if you dont understand something his lecture isnt going to teach you. He tested us like we were graduate students in organic chemistry.The average test grade for exams were 50's, you study but the test defeat you.
Not the easiest subject, even less easy tests. Mechanisms very important to know, but no detail to which one of 6 could be on exam. Still, not too difficult.

Ha? I had him last semester, and I can tell you that this is not a teacher you want to take. You will study hard, read the text book and all, but be surprised on test day. The written questions were easy if you studied, but the multiple choice questions just killed everyone (weird huh?). Yes he did have review sessions, but they really don't help.

I loved him.  I really liked going to class and learning.  while it is a hard class, it is mainly because it is a hard subject.  if you atudy you will do well.  He always makes himself available to his students  and holds a review session (on his own time not class time) before each class.  I really liked this professor

DO NOT, I REPEAT, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!  HE EXPECTS HIS STUDENTS TO ALREADY BE CHEMISTS.  THE CLASS IS INTRO TO CHEMISTRY DUDE!!  HIS TESTS WERE IMPOSSIBLE TO PASS AND HE HAD SUCH A HIGH CURVE THAT A 70 WAS CONSIDERED AN A!!!  THAT SHOULD TELL YOU SOMETHING!!!
DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. HE TEACHES OFF OF HIS OWN KNOWLEDGE INSTEAD OF THE BOOK WHICH MAKES IT HARD TO STUDY FOR THE CLASS. TEST ARE EXTREMELY HARD. I DO NOT RECOMMEND HIM
Do not take him for lab! He grades really hard and is not very helpful. I would definitely not recommend him!

Dr. Haseltine's class is definately not an easy class to get an A. You got to work hard. Keep reading the text book beforehand, and do all the exercise sheets he gives you. The class has weekly quizzes with open book; however, students do not get all 10s. If you want to be challenged, take this course. In my opinion, great teacher.

Worse teacher I've ever taken at KSU. His lectures were nothing like the exams that he gave. Gave an open book quiz every week regardless if we went over the material or not. Even though it was open book, most of the class failed them. If you have a choice, don't waste your time or GPA with Haseltine.

He made this class so hard. His tests were ridiculous and no one would ever pass. He had to curve them severely so people would not fail the class. His lectures were not helpful and all of his test were essay or drawing out molecules. Try to avoid this class if possible!

Dr. Haseltine is definatly NOT an Easy A, if you get an A you gotta work for it. I passed with a low B and I had to really study for the tests. He is very nice and helpful and he really knows what he is talking about. I would recommend him to anyone...but you will have to go to most of the classes and study.
I liked that class. He grades as easy as he can. He gives you alot of open book quizes that can boost your grade. I got a B without cracking the books

Nice but really hard.Open book quizes,3 tests and final.Drops lowest test.Average test grade was in the low 50's, but he curves.Got an A, but spent about 15hrs/wk studying and was one of maybe 4 to get the A.
